name: Pangolin
long_description: Pangolin is an open-source, identity-based remote access platform built on WireGuard that enables secure, seamless connectivity to private and public resources.
one_liner: Identity-aware VPN and proxy for remote access to anything, anywhere.

name: CareSwift
long_description: CareSwift is a real-time AI assistant built directly into ambulance reporting systems, guiding medics as they document care and instantly flagging errors. Crews complete accurate, compliant reports in under three minutes, cutting documentation time by 80 percent and helping agencies avoid insurance claim denials. Ambulance crews lose valuable time completing reports after each call. Even minor mistakes cause insurance claims to be rejected.
one_liner: AI scribe for Ambulance Reports

name: Wedge
long_description: The Operating System for Health AI: we deploy, govern, and scale AI agents across healthcare organizations.
one_liner: Palantir for Healthcare AI Agents

name: Slashy
long_description: AI that helps you fly through your inbox.
one_liner: Cursor for Email

name: cocreate
long_description: Before editing begins, professional video teams spend days copying, organizing, and prepping footage — a process that can eat up 40% of a project’s time and budget. CoCreate runs in the background during backup, delivering fully organized, searchable, and edit-ready projects for Premiere, Avid, Final Cut, or Resolve the moment media is offloaded. The result: faster turnarounds, fewer errors, and more time spent actually editing.
one_liner: AI-native video production software that automates post-production

name: AgentHub
long_description:
AgentHub helps you catch and fix errors in your AI agents - before your users ever see them.

Simulate real-world scenarios in curated RL environments for your agents - trace, evaluate, and improve agent behavior at scale. Generate large annotated datasets and experiment with different prompts, models, and configurations - all in one place - with clear visualizations of what’s working (and what’s not).

Built by a former tech lead from Apple’s Foundation Model Eval team and a product engineer from MIT with experience working on agents at startups, AgentHub makes it easy to integrate your use case and start improving your agents quickly.

Our streamlined onboarding process lets you get your agent eval environment up and running fast—no heavy lifting on your end.

Close the feedback loop and build better agents, faster - with confidence.
one_liner: The simulation and evaluation engine for AI agents

name: Nexa Labs
long_description:
Nexa is developing the solution for cattle monitoring, leveraging implantable microchips that collect more comprehensive biometrics than anything else on the market. Our accompanying AI-driven animal health engine empowers farmers with early disease detection, reproductive insights, GPS tracking, and more. 

We're saving farmers time and money while collecting the world's largest cattle health dataset. We believe that cattle farming should be a science, not an art - this will secure the world's food supply and increase economic output that billions of people depend on.
one_liner: Implantable microchips and AI for cattle monitoring

name: BootLoop
long_description: BootLoop is building the first AI agent to write and test firmware on real hardware. Existing AI coding assistants fail completely with embedded systems, but our agent ingests datasheets, schematics, and other design files to write firmware in your style and automatically test it on your hardware.
one_liner: Firmware in minutes, not months - rigorously tested on real hardware

name: Stellon Labs
long_description: Stellon Labs is an AI research lab that is building tiny frontier AI models that can run on edge devices like smartphones, wearables and embedded systems. Our first open source model, KittenTTS, is a super-tiny text-to-speech model, that got 8K Github stars and 45K model downloads within 2 weeks of launching.
one_liner: Building tiny frontier AI models that run on edge devices

name: Kalinda
long_description:
Kalinda helps class action law firms qualify potential cases in minutes with AI.

The nature of class action/mass torts involves thousands of cases for a single lawsuit. For every plaintiff (injured person), law firms involved in these cases compile everything from the products they used to the injuries they have. This data is extensive, granular, and buried deep in thousands of pages of medical, financial, and employment records and others.

Kalinda extracts, summarizes, and aggregates data from these records for attorneys with AI.

When scaled across an entire litigation, Kalinda works tirelessly and in parallel—turning a process that once took months into just a few hours. 

Kalinda provides firms with the equivalent manpower of hundreds of paralegals and legal nurses, allowing them to quickly determine which claimants are eligible and helping them file faster and in greater volume.

To date, we’ve processed 600k pages of records and are live with 2 of the largest plaintiff law firms in the U.S!
one_liner: Deep research for class action law firms

name: Parachute
long_description: Parachute helps hospitals adopt AI safely and at scale. We vet AI tools that fill clinical gaps, run state-of-the-art evaluations, monitor every model for drift and compliance, and lock every decision in an immutable audit trail.
one_liner: Infrastructure for hospitals to monitor and deploy clinical AI

name: Doe
long_description: Doe is where AI agents actually do your work. Connect your tools, tell Doe what you need, and agents handle it. When you want to do something yourself, Doe makes you faster and smarter. The boring stuff disappears. Everything else gets better.
one_liner: The boring stuff, handled. Everything else, supercharged.

name: IronLedger.ai
long_description:
IronLedger provides AI agents for property accounting, starting with accounts payable. We eliminate more than $70K of accounting costs annually for over 35K multifamily units. Soon, we'll be providing end-to-end accounting services including automated billbacks, month-end close and bank reconciliation.

https://www.ironledger.ai/
one_liner: AI agents for property accounting
subindustry: Real Estate and Construction -> Housing and Real Estate

name: The Interface
long_description: The Interface enables anyone to create, interact, and share on the fly — from TV shows to games to movies. Drawing on deep expertise in realtime compute and simulation, we combine multimodal AI with the best of 3D simulation and modelling techniques, to deliver real-time experiences that are alive, interactive, and emergent.
one_liner: The foundations for AI-native media

name: Trace
long_description:
Trace is a workflow automation platform that routes tasks to the right agent – human or AI. We enable enterprise-grade context and AI orchestration in mid-sized teams. 

Trace breaks workflows into clear steps, sends repetitive tasks to AI agents, and routes the rest to the right people while respecting permissions and logging every action. 

We help teams cut busywork and unify AI tools across departments – helping companies adopt AI in days rather than months.
one_liner: Workflow automation that routes tasks to humans and AI

name: Fulcrum
long_description:
We build red-teaming agents that help developers fix their RL environments and improve their agents.

Our customers are tired of being bullshitted by their agents.
one_liner: The agentic debugger for AI systems

name: b12 Labs
long_description:
b12 is an AI copilot that plans how to create and test new molecules for chemists. We're like a GPS for chemistry, helping pharma companies plan the recipes for new drugs, accelerating early-stage drug discovery from years to months. 
Andres built the first AI agent that can autonomously think and make molecules in a robotic lab, published in Nature Machine Intelligence (750+ citations), and won the best paper award at the NeurIPS AI for Science conference.
Zlatko is a 3x National Chemistry Olympiad champion, competed at IChO level, and medicinal chemist who has worked at Roche and leading lab robotics companies. He has an extensive network of hundreds of chemists across Europe.
We are publishing a groundbreaking paper in Nature demonstrating our AI's ability to optimally plan chemical recipes. We run paid pilots with big pharma companies showing that our platform planned a set of experiments that achieved full conversion in a single attempt, eliminating the usual 8-12 iteration cycle.
one_liner: Chemical Copilot for Pharma and Biotech

name: Flai
long_description:
The problem we solve: 56% of dealership leads arrive after business hours, and most dealers lose these potential customers to competitors who happen to be available 24/7. Missing after-hours calls alone costs the average dealership $1M annually in lost revenue.

We built Flai to fix this - AI assistants that answer dealership calls 24/7, scheduling test drives, oil changes, or running outbound recall campaigns so no opportunity slips away.

The result: No more missed opportunities, no more losing customers to competitors.

Our founding team has built voice AI products at HappyRobot, scaled infrastructure at Uber for millions of users, and applied data science at Netflix to solve operational challenges.

We're not just answering phones, we're helping dealerships win in an AI-first world where availability determine who gets the sale.
one_liner: We Bring Customers to Your Dealership

name: Embedder
long_description: Embedder is a coding agent that can write, test, and debug firmware on both physical and simulated hardware. Supporting 20+ MCU/SoC platforms, it accelerates embedded systems development across semiconductors, automotive, medical devices, aerospace, IoT, and consumer electronics.
one_liner: Cursor for Firmware

name: Candytrail
long_description: We’re building the optimization platform for in-person sales teams. Our agents capture every customer interaction and surface insights on winning talk tracks, common objections, and revenue drivers. We have already delivered an average 13% lift in revenue for customers in pharma, real estate, and retail.
one_liner: AI agents for in-person sales teams, starting with coaching

name: Epicenter
long_description:
Epicenter is an ecosystem of open-source, local-first apps. We store all your work—notes, transcripts, chat histories—in a single folder of plain text and SQLite. Every tool we build shares this memory: your text editor, personal assistant, etc.. It's open, tweakable, and yours. Grep it, open it in Obsidian, host it wherever you like. The choice is yours.

Our vision is to build a personal workspace where you own your data, choose your own AI models, and replace siloed apps with open, interoperable alternatives. All while preserving authenticity and being free and open source. ❤️
one_liner: Open-source, local-first apps that share a memory.

name: Channel3
long_description:
Channel3 is building a database of every product on the internet.

Google and OpenAI maintain vast product graphs, but keep that valuable data to themselves. Channel3 gives every developer access, opening a world of possibility for new shopping experiences across any vertical. For instance, developers could build AI fashion stylists or give their agents shopping capabilities.

We don’t just collect product data; we actually understand it. With the latest image classification and reasoning models, we can match products across merchants—even when listings and images differ—recognize variants, and surface the perfect matches for every search. As we grow, we’ll capture unique insights into what users want, click, and buy.

As AI models get smarter and cheaper, our flywheel accelerates: our catalog will improve, and it will be even easier for developers and vibe-coders to build on our infrastructure. To further incentivize building on Channel3, we provide built-in monetization; developers earn commissions on sales they drive.

Alex discovered this need while building an AI tutor that could recommend products and earn affiliate revenue. When no solution existed, he persuaded his smartest friend from Duke and former co-founder George to leave Palantir and build Channel3 together.
one_liner: Database of every product on the internet

name: GhostEye
long_description:
GhostEye uses autonomous AI agents to test how attackers exploit human vulnerabilities to compromise organizations. Just as red teams simulate technical attacks against infrastructure, we simulate sophisticated social engineering campaigns and beyond against people. 

Our multi-agent platform validates complete attack paths from initial human compromise to data exfiltration, providing security teams with actionable intelligence about their true human attack surface exposure before attackers find it.
one_liner: Human-Layer Breach and Attack Breach Simulation

name: Normal
long_description: Developing infrastructure to make robots useful in the real world
one_liner: Deploying and integrating useful robots

name: Comena
long_description: We build AI agents that automate order processing for industrial distributors and manufacturers. Say goodbye to inside sales and customer service teams spending hours on manual data entry. Comena streamlines order and quote entry, from inbox to ERP, freeing up sales teams to focus on high-value activities and proactive selling.
one_liner: AI agents for distributors and manufacturers to automate order entry.

name: VibeFlow
long_description: VibeFlow generates full-stack web apps from prompts with n8n-style visual workflows for the backend. Users of tools like Lovable or v0 can easily iterate over frontends because they can see them, while backends remain closed black boxes that are hard to evolve through prompting. VibeFlow opens up backend logic, making it visual and editable, with powerful integrations built in.
one_liner: Lovable, n8n and a database all in one platform

name: Nozomio
long_description:
Nozomio is a product lab building engineers for the age of AI.

As coding agents become ubiquitous, the real bottleneck shifts from “write code” to “know which code and docs to feed them.” Starting with the tool named Nia, the mission is to provide context enrichment through agentic research and indexing of any external codebase(-s) or documentation via MCP / API.

Nozomio started with Arlan's early frustration with the agentic coding ecosystem, especially around context and memory. After winning Product of the Day in February and raising pre-seed, Arlan moved to London and then to SF as a solo immigrant from Kazakhstan to build the future of software engineering. 

try nia at trynia .ai <3
one_liner: Context augmentation for agents

name: Mimos
long_description:
Mimos helps companies rank in AI search.

800 million people use ChatGPT every week. Today, customers don’t see 10 blue links, they see an answer. And if your brand isn’t cited, you basically don’t exist. 

Our agents automate the playbook for becoming the answer:
 1. Pinpoint Visibility Gaps: Analyzes your site, competitors, and customer data to find precise ranking opportunities.
 2. Craft the Solution: Automatically stages technical fixes and generates policy-aligned content in your brand's voice. 
 3. Integrate with CMS: Instantly deploy fixes and content to your site, driving new leads in days, not months.

Learn more at trymimos.com

===

Rohit & Michael have been working together on various technical project since 6th grade (14 years!) - and Mimos came about as one of those projects.
one_liner: Helping companies rank in AI search

name: GoRiff
long_description:
Riff is a music editor with superpowers — helping artists work faster and making it easier than ever for hobbyists to break into music.

As we continue to build, we see Riff turning into an entirely new paradigm for creating music.
one_liner: Cursor for music production

name: Albacore Inc.
long_description: Albacore is building 6ft-long drone submarines to deter littoral conflict. Our first product, Ghostfin can be launched from land in minutes, and carry precision effects or conduct sensing missions up to 1,000 nautical miles. Our team consists of multiple serial entrepreneurs in defense and hardware who have worked alongside top DoD leadership on autonomous platforms.
one_liner: Autonomous undersea vehicles to deter maritime invasions.

name: Solva
long_description: The domain specific AI for claims that gives leading insurers clarity and speed on the most complex claims
one_liner: Automates insurance claims and stops incorrect payouts

name: Phases
long_description: Phases uses AI to automate clinical trial operations, starting with patient recruitment. Our agent scans medical records and conducts human-like voice interviews to assess patient eligibility for clinical trials. Our vision is to run the entire clinical trial back-office with agents, getting drugs to market at a fraction of the time and cost it takes today.
one_liner: Automating clinical trials, starting with patient recruitment.

name: Perseus Defense
long_description:
Perseus Defense is building a mass-manufactured Counter UAS solution for the Department of Defense and Department of Homeland Security. Current solutions are one-to-one, too dangerous for use on U.S. soil, and orders of magntiude more expensive than the threats they defeat. Our self-guided missile platform is man-portable and multi-domain capable. It senses, engages, and eliminates threats with drastically reduced cost per engagement over existing kinetic solutions. 

Solving this critical national security problem requires understanding complex DoD needs along with actual rocket science including aerodynamics, guidance, navigation, control, and much more. Jason and Steve met at Penn State while they pursued their PhD and MS in aerospace engineering, respectively. Their past experiences designing space helicopters for NASA, making Boeing airliners land autonomously, controlling swarms of unmanned autonomous systems, teaching aerospace engineering at Stanford, winning multiple ONR and DOE engineering competitions, and founding an international drone competition makes them the perfect team to create transformative solutions protecting our service members. 

"If you build this, it will be mandatory equipment for every truck, boat, and convoy in the U.S. Military. We're talking thousands of units." - Former DoD Procurement Officer

The White House just released Executive Order, "Unleashing American Drone Dominance" which adds billions of dollars, government support, and streamlined regulations to enable the development of our product. 

Traction: 
Jason and Steve used more than 100 end-user interviews across the DoD and DHS to shape the product to something of critical need to both boots on the ground and DoD purchasers. In 8 short weeks following a strict 2-week design-build-test cycle, the team has gone through 4 major guided missile iterations with over 30 live-fire flight tests. They were invited to Ft. Hood to present their platform to the 1st Cavalry Division, and also briefed the Pentagon and U.S. congressmen on current U.S. vulnerabilities to advanced drone technology.  Perseus Defense is actively standing up cooperative research agreements with U.S. Army DEVCOM's Applied Research Laboratory, Aviation and Missile Center, Armaments Center, and High Performance Computing Modernization Program.
one_liner: America's Golden Dome for Drones

name: Novaflow
long_description:
Novaflow is the AI data analyst for biology labs. 
--
Bioinformatics data analysis is a time-consuming and expensive process for scientists. With Novaflow, life scientists can upload experimental data, ask questions in plain English, and get instant, publication-ready plots, giving them results in minutes instead of months.

Researchers at leading institutions like UCSF, Mount Sinai, UC Berkeley, and Harvard are already using Novaflow in their labs.
one_liner: The AI data analyst for biology labs

name: mcp-use
long_description:
mcp-use provides open-source dev tools and infrastructure for MCP to help dev teams quickly build and deploy custom AI agents with MCP servers. 
Our library has over 170,000 downloads and 7,000 stars, and is used by hundreds of engineers at big enterprises.
We provide a hosted and self-hosted platform that manages auth, access control, and multi-user environments for secure MCP agents deployment at scale.
one_liner: Open-source dev tools and infrastructure for MCP.

name: Hyprnote
long_description: Hyprnote is the first open-source AI notetaker for the enterprise. It runs fully on-device or on-prem, ensuring that no data ever leaves your system. Hyprnote transcribes and summarizes conversations automatically, turning discussions into actionable knowledge without risking security or regulatory breaches. Unlike cloud-based tools like Granola or Otter, Hyprnote is built for industries where data control is non-negotiable - tech firms, finance, healthcare, government, and beyond.
one_liner: Open-source AI notetaker for the enterprise

name: Relling
one_liner: RL and Data Infrastructure for Robotic World Models

name: Motives
long_description: Motives is a team of AI agents that runs qualitative research projects for consumer brands: moderating and analyzing video interviews to help brands understand consumer preferences and test new ideas, in hours instead of weeks.
one_liner: Consumer focus groups run by AI

name: Finto
long_description: Finto builds AI accounting software for enterprise finance teams. We automate the invoice-to-pay process from their email inbox to their ERP. Cutting out 80% of the accountants daily work in invoice recording, account coding and  invoice approvals.
one_liner: AI accounting for enterprise finance teams

name: Iron Grid
one_liner: AI Insurance for hardware.

name: April
long_description: April is a voice AI Executive assistant that manages your email and calendar, hands free. It’s built for busy individuals who need EAs but don’t have them.
one_liner: Voice AI Executive Assistant

name: Autosana
long_description:
Autosana uses AI agents to save countless engineering hours and help teams ship with more confidence. 

Turns natural language into E2E tests, eradicating manual testing and the need to write/maintain UX scripts. Seamlessly integrates into your CI, supports both iOS and Android, and is framework-agnostic (React Native, Flutter, Swift, etc).

Catching bugs before users do.
one_liner: AI Agents for Mobile QA

name: Knowlify
long_description:
Everyone loves the way 3Blue1Brown explains complex ideas. Now imagine having that same level of clarity for any topic, tailored to each learner’s needs.

That’s what we’re building at Knowlify.

Current use cases:
- Researchers turn dense papers into clear, digestible explanations
- Textbook publishers help students grasp challenging concepts
- Universities produce high-quality content while cutting costs by 90%
- Corporations keep teams sharp and up to date on the latest technologies

With Knowlify, the possibilities for learning are limitless.
one_liner: Convert textual content into explainer videos in < 15s

name: Omnara
long_description: Omnara is the command center for AI agents. We enable developers to launch AI agents like Claude Code on their laptop and then seamlessly continue working on mobile, freeing engineers from being desk-bound. With a growing community of users, Omnara is building the essential infrastructure for the era of AI agents.
one_liner: The Command Center for AI Agents

name: Risely AI
long_description:
Risely’s AI agents will form the new operating system for universities, improving retention, staff productivity, and efficiency. Our platform integrates directly into existing university systems (SIS, LMS, CRM), learns each institution’s unique workflows, and deploys specialized AI agents. This dramatically reduces the $735 billion universities spend annually on administrative labor, expands staff capacity without increasing headcount, and improves the student experience.

This hasn't been done before because university workflows require nuanced, autonomous judgment, exactly what agentic AI was designed to solve. Our team uniquely combines deep expertise in higher education, enterprise-scale AI, and regulated enterprise sales.

Sadia previously built Salesforce’s Education Cloud from scratch, creating the core Student Information System widely used across higher education. She deeply understands university operations and maintains trusted relationships with hundreds of higher-ed CIOs and Provosts.

Danial was one of DoorDash’s earliest engineers, where he architected and scaled complex systems from zero to billions of transactions, including their search, recommendation, and Voice AI platforms. He knows how to build robust AI solutions that reliably perform at enterprise scale. 

Shahryar was a GM at Airwallex, where he built the entire Americas business from 0 to 1 and drove 11x revenue growth.  He’s also a master closer, single-handedly securing over $17M in enterprise deals at NerdWallet.  He’s a relentless startup executor with deep expertise launching and scaling go-to-market machines in highly regulated industries.

We launched six weeks ago and are already at $8k MRR, growing 55% week-over-week -- one of the fastest ramps ever in higher ed. Universities urgently need solutions that expand labor capacity and efficiency, especially as they face unprecedented budget pressure and staffing shortages.

With unmatched buyer access, deep technical expertise, and rapid early traction, we are perfectly positioned to own this enormous market.
one_liner: AI agents that automate administrative work across college campuses.

name: Minimal AI
long_description: Minimal AI makes it easy for e-commerce brands to build and manage AI support teams that resolve 80%+ of tickets while increasing revenue.
one_liner: AI Agents for E-commerce Customer Support

name: Socratix AI
long_description:
Socratix builds AI coworkers for fraud and risk teams so that humans don't have to spend their days drowning in alerts and spreadsheets.

Today, fraud and risk teams at fintechs and banks are overwhelmed. Analysts jump between tools, manually stitch together context, and make judgment calls under pressure, often for hundreds of alerts a week. Too much of their work is slow, repetitive, and error-prone. We're here to change that. 

Socratix gives fraud and risk teams AI coworkers that investigate alerts in real time, replacing manual reviews with fast, explainable decisions. Socratix agents plug into existing workflows and reason across signals just like human analysts to help teams reduce fraud losses, minimize false positives, and scale operations without scaling headcount.

We've seen this problem firsthand. At DoorDash, Riya helped save $30M+ a year by building smarter fraud detection and investigation tooling, and at Unit21, she built products for analysts that made them 3X faster. We're able to build and sell enterprise-grade software. At Cruise, Satya built scalable AI systems powering petabyte-scale data, and at LinkedIn, he built enterprise products from 0 to 1 generating $50M+ in incremental revenue. Now, the two of us are teaming up to eliminate the manual toil in fraud and risk.

We're obsessed with fraud, LLMs, real-world automation, and the messy edge cases traditional ML has trouble handling. We believe that every fraud analyst should have an AI coworker - and the future of fraud will involve combining human-level reasoning with machine-speed execution.
one_liner: AI coworkers for fraud and risk teams.

name: Alara
long_description: Alara aggregates product listings from numerous suppliers, shows real-time price comparisons, and lets dentists order from different vendors in a single cart. With Alara, dental offices are saving time and money when ordering supplies.
one_liner: Procurement Platform for Dental Offices

name: Floot
long_description:
Floot lets non-coders & entrepreneurs build real web apps that actually work. We’re taking a new approach by building everything from the ground up for AI.

✨ Try building an app at floot.com

Existing AI app builders fall short of enabling non-coders to build real, serious apps. They often:
- Break down when building anything more than a prototype or toy app
- Have non-coders stuck with errors they don’t understand
- Require non-coders to handle multiple services designed for developers (e.g. for backend, database, hosting, etc)

The fundamental problem: these AI app builders just cobble together existing developer tools and slap AI on top, but these tools were designed for humans and not for AI.

The result? Non-coders get excited, start building, hit a wall, and then abandon their projects.

Floot is purpose-built for AI. Our secret sauce:

1) Instead of reusing a coding framework designed for humans, we created a specialized framework that dictates how AI should write code and how the code runs on our infrastructure. This allows us to enforce best practices, detect errors earlier, and give the best feedback to the AI. As a result, Floot can write better code and fix issues more effectively.

2) Floot has the entire tech stack built-in (backend, database, hosting, etc) so building and managing an app feels seamless, especially for non-coders. And because we control every layer of the stack, we can optimize each layer for AI-first coding.

Because of this, non-coders can get more done with less time and prompting. They can finally build serious apps that work, instead of getting stuck in frustrating error loops and then abandoning their projects.

We also built a highly scalable hosting system directly on AWS so Floot apps can handle real traffic and business demands. This means non-coders can build, deploy, and scale their apps on a single platform seamlessly.

Plus, Floot is really fun to use! Try building an app at floot.com
one_liner: The easiest way for non-coders to build apps with AI.

name: Idler
long_description: Idler builds reinforcement learning environments that teach AI models to code at expert human levels. We create training environments based on real-world coding scenarios that prepare models for the complex challenges they'll face in production.
one_liner: Reinforcement learning environments.

name: Palace
long_description:
Palace (palace.so) plans, coordinates, and executes daily back-office work for trucking fleets. By automating the manual decisions that consume planning, dispatch, and CSR teams (assigning loads, managing appointments, communicating updates, and resolving exceptions) carriers can increase revenue-per-driver while running leaner teams.

Leeds and Derek have been building together as close friends for over six years. The team have been early PMs/engineers at exited startups and decacorns and worked on the algorithms behind Amazon’s robotic logistics systems.
one_liner: Palace plans, coordinates, and executes daily ops for trucking fleets

name: Humoniq
long_description:
Humoniq is building the first AI-Native BPO for the travel & transport industries, which outsource $20B of customer support each year. Our AI-native approach improves speed, accuracy, and satisfaction.

Our team is uniquely equipped to solve this challenge. We previously grew a travel management company, Flightfox (YC S12), to $22M/yr. We handled thousands of customer requests each month, which exposed the limitations of traditional outsourcing.
one_liner: AI-Native BPO for travel & transport

name: Nautilus
long_description: Nautilus is the first modern platform built for car washes, replacing expensive legacy systems that cost operators thousands monthly. Nautilus delivers mobile-first e-commerce, membership management, and automated marketing. Learn more at nautilus.co.
one_liner: AI platform to grow and to optimize car washes

name: Avelis Health
long_description:
𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐰𝐞 𝐛𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬:
I (Angel) have had three knee surgeries since my mid-teens and was billed more than $250K for care that should have cost a fraction of that. Fighting those inflated charges was so painful that we set out to build a consumer-facing AI agent to do it for others. In less than five months, we helped sixty patients erase or reduce over $300K from their medical bills.

This inspired us to fix the problem farther upstream: stopping bad payments before the patient ever sees a bill. So we launched payment integrity, machine-learning models that audit every medical claim for self-insured employers and health plans in real time.

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐦:
• Self-insured employers waste $60 B+ each year on claims that never should have been paid. Healthcare is the 2nd largest company expense after payroll.

• Manual audits are slow and partial: Reviewers focus only on high-dollar claims, letting millions more slip through unnoticed.

• Existing audit software is static: Decades-old rule engines can’t keep pace with evolving codes, contracts, or billing tactics.

• Incentives are misaligned: Third-party administrators are paid to process claims, not to police them, so accuracy checks are minimal.

𝐎𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧:
Our models audit medical claims before and after payments have been issued. We catch nuanced billing, coding, and contract errors to save 3-7% on annual claims spend. We work with self-insured employers and health plans.

𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐔𝐬:
Angel Onuoha (CEO) and Ahmad Shehu (CTO) have worked together for 4 years. Before Avelis Health they built Zuvy, a Lagos-based fintech company that provided invoice factoring to small businesses. Zuvy was acquired by The BAS Group in 2025.
one_liner: We audit medical claims for self-insured employers and health plans.

name: PARES AI
long_description:
PARES is the single platform commercial real estate brokers need for their entire workflow, from chasing leads to closing deals and everything in between. 

With our platform, brokers can:

1) Automatically update real-time transaction data in our CRM

2) Create lists of target properties, skip-trace, and easily navigate outbound calls

3) Underwrite deals with our AI Underwriting Agent

4) Create OMs/BOVs in minutes with our AI Marketing Agent

Check us out at https://www.pares.ai/
one_liner: Helping commercial real estate brokers find and close more deals.

name: Altur
long_description: Voice AI Agents for Debt Collection
one_liner: Voice AI Agents for Debt Collection

name: Eden
long_description:
Eden runs marketing for ecommerce brands. Our AI agents can autonomously schedule campaigns, run A/B tests, and personalize experiences across email, SMS, site display, and more, so brand founders get enterprise-level marketing without needing a team or agency.

Alex and Jason have been best friends for 8+ years. They met at TJHSST, became nationally ranked debate partners, and later coworkers at Datadog. Alex led operations at an AI shopping startup, working directly with brands like TheRealReal, Poshmark, and Farfetch. Jason was at Reddit's mobile ad retargeting team and is a second-time founder, previously exiting an AI recruiting startup doing $50K MRR.
one_liner: Autonomous Marketing AI for Ecommerce Brands

name: Metis
long_description: We build infrastructure enabling AI agents to reliably perform complex tasks in production
one_liner: Infrastructure to build reliable agents

name: F4
long_description:
Built by former Tesla & SpaceX engineers, F4 is a platform that helps you catch and fix drawing compliance issues instantly. F4 ensures design engineers never release noncompliant drawings—and suppliers never misinterpret them. We help hardware teams eliminate costly scrap, rework, and miscommunication at the root.

With a compliant drawing, F4 generates end-to-end drawing interpretations for standard definitions, inspection plan, and tolerance analysis application.

F4 automatically interprets all GD&T symbols, datums, and notes based on the correct standards - no more second-guessing or misreading intent. Everyone from design to manufacturing sees the same definition, keeping teams aligned and avoiding costly miscommunication.

F4 generates a complete inspection plan straight from the drawing, so quality teams know exactly what to measure, how, and where. This eliminates manual setup, reduces delays during first article inspection, and helps catch issues before they reach production.

F4 gives engineers everything they need from the drawing to set up a reliable tolerance analysis, applicable features, and rule exceptions. By making it easy to bridge engineering drawings to tolerance analysis, teams can catch potential fit or function issues early - before parts are fabricated and assembled.
one_liner: Automating compliance checks for engineering drawings

name: Sira
long_description:
Sira is the AI-powered platform for managing time tracking, scheduling, payroll, and HR — purpose-built for hourly teams.

Our intelligent agents handle the manual, time-consuming tasks for you — like calling workers to fill open shifts, detecting timesheet anomalies, and streamlining payroll processing.

With Sira, businesses stay organized, compliant, and focused on what really matters — while we take care of the team.
one_liner: AI Native Rippling for Deskless Workers

name: Opennote
long_description:
Opennote is the one space for everything you study, turning chaos into clarity.

Most learners struggle with scattered knowledge across different apps and tools that don't understand their learning style. Opennote changes that with a note-taking platform where AI knows your style, connects to your existing knowledge bases and the web, and provides proactive feedback and edits—right where you're already working.
one_liner: Write, learn, and connect ideas—all in one place

name: SigmanticAI
former_names: BitForge (in process of incorporating as SigmanticAI Inc due to trademark)
long_description:
SigmanticAI is building an AI-native hardware development assistant that automates the entire RTL design flow, from natural language to synthesizable HDL and testbenches, inside a seamless VSCode fork. Powered by fine-tuned Verilog LLMs, reinforcement learning, and real compiler feedback, SigmanticAI iteratively refines code until it compiles and passes synthesis, no matter how complex the design. It’s like the Cursor for HDL design. 

In addition to code generation, SigmanticAI can generate token-level annotations and onboarding documents to accelerate ramp-up for new engineers. With support for both cloud and on-prem deployment, it integrates with existing EDA tools to dramatically reduce debug time, improve collaboration, and accelerate hardware design across teams
one_liner: The Cursor for Chip Design - Delivering Silicon-Ready Chip Designs…

name: Convexia
long_description:
An AI-maximalist pharma platform. We use agents to buy drugs, run clinical trials, and sell for a profit. 10x faster and 20x leaner than incumbents.

Sourcing Agent: Mines public/private databases and unstructured global data to surface overlooked preclinical candidates.
Scientific Agent: Runs comp bio models (ESM-3, RFdiffusion, Boltz-2, AlphaFold) to assess safety and efficacy in silico.
Commercial Agent: Analyzes FDA incentives, pricing dynamics, TAM, competitive landscape, and payer alignment.
Clinical Agent: Runs digital twin simulations, evaluates CRO/CMC risk, and builds trial plans to Phase 1.
BD Agent: Summarizes and delivers company-tailored pitches. 

Built by 2 Stanford CS students who have built 3 startups together before.
one_liner: The world's first AI-maximalist pharma company

name: Pleom
long_description: Automatic insights on all your company data. Speed up business workflows to visualizations with a 0 learning curve.
one_liner: Agentic Business Intelligence

name: Locata
long_description:
Locata is an AI referral management platform for Primary Care. We deploy AI agents to automate every step of the referral process that back-office staff face daily, from submitting prior authorizations to broadcasting updates and following up with patients. This frees up staff to focus on patient care.

Primary care back-offices are severely understaffed and overburdened by administrative work associated with referrals. Additionally, patients suffer navigating the complex referral process, which can have disastrous health effects if they don’t get the care they need. These factors point to a glaring gap in the system—where out of over 100 million specialist referrals issued annually in the US, only half are actually completed. Locata is tackling this problem head-on, saving administrative staff hours each week and ensuring that the referral process goes as smoothly as possible for patients and their providers.

Alejandro and Josh met at Stanford where they graduated with BS degrees in Computer Science. Alejandro was a senior software engineer at Meta’s Reality Labs where he led development of several AI features for wearable products and prior to that conducted AI research at Stanford Medicine. Josh graduated with a masters in Computer Science, specializing in AI, before working as a software engineer at Google where he developed AI products that served over 1 billion users.

Within two weeks of building our product, we signed a major regional health center and have saved them over 100 hours of work in our first month live.
one_liner: AI Referral Automation for Primary Care Clinics

name: Pally
long_description:
We spend our lives in messaging apps. Slack. iMessage. WhatsApp. We face a constant stream of information, introductions, and things we need to do.

What if you could bring together every message, from every platform, in a Superhuman-like experience, with AI agents that automatically complete your action items?

That’s exactly what we’re building at Pally; a future where you never need to check another inbox again.
one_liner: Intelligent Unified Inbox + Personal CRM

name: Nottelabs
long_description: Nottelabs offers a platform to build and deploy enterprise-grade browser agents. We help companies cut costs and save time by automating repetitive tasks. Unlike others, we provide agents, tools, and infrastructure through a single API, making us the fastest path to reliable web AI agents in production.
one_liner: Reliable Web Agents for Enterprise

name: Hera
long_description:
Hera is an AI motion designer that turns 5-hour projects into 5-minute tasks. 

When you're a YouTuber making an infographic animation, instead of spending hours manually clicking buttons in Adobe After Effects, you can create the same animation in minutes in Hera. 

Through talking to our users, we realized that 95% of time spent on motion graphics is manual button clicking, not creative work. This insight led us to focus on automating the tedious parts while giving the user all creative control.

We launched in May 2025, got 100k waitlist signups in 8 weeks, and we're doubling revenue monthly.
one_liner: AI Motion Designer

name: Certus AI
long_description:
Certus AI is replacing the restaurant phone line with Voice AI.

Restaurants lose up to $100,000 per year per location from missed calls, lost orders, and abandoned hold lines. Staff are overwhelmed. IVRs frustrate customers. Call centers are expensive and impersonal.

It’s 2025. Guests don’t leave voicemails or wait on hold. They just move on.

Certus is an AI voice agent built for restaurants. It answers every call, 24/7 — taking orders, processing deliveries, booking reservations, upselling, and handling complaints in English, Spanish, French and more. Certus is built to manage the phone line end to end, from the customer call to the restaurant tech stack, with zero human intervention required. It currently integrates with industry-leading systems like Toast, Square, Clover, UberEats, DoorDash, and more.

We’re building the voice layer of the modern restaurant — the employee they’ll never fire.

We started Certus because we lived the pain. Gurveer (CEO) grew up answering phones in his family’s restaurant and helped operate them, growing from 1 to 11 locations in 7 years. Later, he and Adam (CRO) ran a restaurant growth startup to help others increase revenue, but kept watching clients bleed cash because no one picked up the phone. So we built the solution the industry always wished existed.

Until now, this problem was considered unsolvable. But Voice AI has finally crossed the conversational chasm and 72% of consumers now prefer AI over humans as long as it means faster and better service.

More importantly, the market is begging for this. The North American restaurant industry crossed $1 trillion in 2024, and it's projected to hit $1.5 trillion in 2025. Yet over $100 billion is still lost annually to missed calls, human error, and outdated tech. As the market continues to grow, so do the losses!

Our customers say it best:

- “Certus changed my life overnight.”
- “We were losing the ability to give great in-house service — the phone was killing us.”
-  “70% of my business comes through the phone. That’s mine and my 16 staffs livelihood.”
- “Before Certus, I used to lose 40 - 60 calls a day…. now my printer just stays printing!”
-  “I’ve been in the business 38 years. I’ve been waiting for this since then.”

Certus is here to fix the $120B phone problem — one call at a time.

And in doing so, we’re redefining how the restaurant industry communicates forever, starting with the phone line.
one_liner: Replacing the restaurant phone line with Voice AI

name: Reacher
long_description:
Reacher is an AI-powered platform that automates creator marketing workflows—from discovery and outreach to campaign management and content strategy—making marketing teams 10x more productive. 

We handle the manual tasks so brands can focus on building relationships with creators while centralizing their operations in one platform to manage creators on TikTok Shop, Instagram, and YouTube.
one_liner: We automate creator marketing for the world's largest brands

name: Kernel
long_description:
Kernel is crazy fast, open source infra for AI agents to access the internet 🧠🕸️
- Built on unikernels for crazy fast cold starts and low resource usage
- Sub-150ms cold starts on managed headful browsers
- Built-in stealth mode with residential proxies and automatic CAPTCHA solving
- Full observability: session recording, live view, and full logs
- Persistent sessions that maintain cookies and auth across invocations
- Native support for all browser and computer use frameworks
- SOC 2 compliant and HIPAA-ready

Trusted by Cash App, Rye, and 1000+ others. Backed by Accel & Y Combinator (S25).
one_liner: Crazy fast, open source infra for AI agents to use the Internet

name: dScribe AI
long_description:
dScribe AI uses autonomous drones and 3D vision to track bulk inventory. We're starting by helping the ag and mining industry track stockpiles of grain and gravel.

Bulk inventory tracking is broken. Companies either rely on guesstimates or pay for expensive manual surveys which are still off by 30 to 50%. Without accurate numbers, it’s hard to plan logistics, like how many truckloads are needed. And it creates accounting issues by misreporting inventory value, hurting financial planning and leading to missed opportunities.

We’ve lived this problem, and we know how to solve it. Warren saw it firsthand as a Product Manager at Milk Moovement, a $20M Series A AgTech startup, working closely with feed suppliers and farm managers. Cole was engineer #3 at Tropic, scaling it from seed to Series B, and later led engineering at an AI startup.

We’ve built an integrated hardware and software platform and have signed one of the largest agricultural company in North America. As industries demand real-time visibility into the physical world, dScribe AI is positioned to become the system of record for inventory that don’t fit in traditional boxes and barcodes.
one_liner: Computer vision for bulk inventory tracking

name: Okibi
long_description:
Okibi is a web app that lets you create AI coworkers using natural language.

It's like Lovable for creating AI agents that talk to your internal software

Corporate users lose 2 hours every day doing tasks that can be automated with agents

But existing agent builders have janky drag and drop UIs that don’t map to what they want exactiy.

Okibi lets everyone use natural language to build the exact agent they want.
one_liner: Build AI coworkers using natural language, it's Lovable for agents

name: Juxta
long_description:
Juxta is creating the first Universal Positioning System (UPS) — a GPS alternative that can monitor movement anywhere on earth with no new hardware, minimal internet connection, and remote deployment. Using custom machine learning models and a first-of-its-kind synthetic fingerprinting technology, Juxta can make any indoor, outdoor, or underground space location-aware in minutes for a fraction of the cost of any other geospatial technology.

Juxta's UPS can be leveraged across industries — from securely tracking soldiers in combat zones to providing offline positioning for robots to offering asset tracking in warehouses and ports around the globe.
one_liner: Building a GPS alternative 100x more powerful with no hardware needed.

name: Flywheel AI
long_description: Flywheel AI converts any existing excavators for contractors to enable remote ops to increase safety and productivity, and use robotics context dataset to train autonomous policies.
one_liner: Waymo for excavators

name: stagewise
long_description:
stagewise builds an open-source frontend coding agent for real codebases. We enable backend devs, designers and product managers to build pretty and functional web apps in a simple and visually guided manner - no matter the used tech stack.

stagewise lives right inside your browser, makes changes in your local codebase and is compatible with all kinds of frameworks and setups - allowing it to be retrofitted into any existing project. Our agent enables you to show and tell what you want to change - all while using your app on localhost and without having to switch to external tools. Making changes is as easy as selecting elements, giving a simple prompt like “make it green and put it in the top right corner”, and immediately seeing the result.

We're two founders from Germany who met while working at a B2B SaaS startup. With Glenn's background in building dev tools for enterpries (Rheinmetall, Miele), as well as Julians experience in building web apps used by thousands (saasmetrix, strukto.io), we have the unique blend of experience and product sense needed to build this.

After making our initial launch with the open-sourced toolbar that puts your favorite coding agent right inside your browser and going viral with it, we’re now launching a high-speed coding agent dedicated to frontend development - taking our product and the experience of our users to the next level.

Our vision is to replace frontend devs completely, by gradually enabling both the backend devs, but also less technical designers and product managers to create well-designed applications. We start with developers who lack design experience, but our ultimate goal is to change how products are built.
one_liner: The frontend coding agent for real codebases.

name: Clodo
long_description: Clodo is the AI Copilot for Outbound Sales
one_liner: AI Copilot for Outbound Sales

name: Fleetline
long_description: Fleetline is building the first complete-context algorithmic load planner for mid to large-sized trucking fleets. Today’s dispatchers face an overwhelming task: balancing regulations, customer demands, live fleet data, and individual driver needs, all while coordinating across siloed tools and teams. Mistakes run rampant, and each mistake is thousands of dollars. Even the select fleets using algorithms that have fleet-wide context struggle: the outputs are rigid, hard to interpret, and are blind to real-world nuances like driver preferences and schedule exceptions. Fleetline solves this by combining advanced optimization with LLMs that can easily adapt algorithms to each fleet’s needs and capture driver-specific information. The result is smarter planning truly optimized for every fleet and its drivers.
one_liner: Optimizing fleet planning with data driven algorithms

name: Magnetic
long_description:
Magnetic scans client documents - from handwritten charity notes to excel spreadsheet Schedule Cs to multi-state K-1s - and enters them into tax software automatically, saving hours of tedious data entry. 

The accounting profession is facing a massive talent shortage, as graduates choose different professions and the old guard begins to retire. As a result, CPA and tax preparation firms are awash in clientele, but unable to keep up. At many firms, phones go unanswered, clients are "fired", and websites are taken down, as the existing workforce tries to handle the grueling 80 hour+ weeks necessary to push through tax season to the April 15th deadline.

We built this because a former colleague who owns her own tax firm asked us to automate her workload, and we quickly realized the massive opportunity. Thomas brings deep domain expertise as the former Head of Product at Keeper (YC W19), where he built tax engine automation systems and an OCR form scanning system that outperformed everything else on the market. At Keeper, he leveraged early access to OpenAI's LLMs (well before ChatGPT) to build systems that automated the entire tax filing process, allowing a tiny team of CPAs to process thousands of returns with near zero busy work. Patrick was the first engineer at FunCraft, shipping multiple mobile games with 1M+ downloads and building scalable shared codebases. We've worked together since 2017, including co-leading multiple teams at Zynga as PM & Tech Lead respectively.

We launched this year in the middle of tax season and quickly processed hundreds of returns, earning thousands in ARR, and since tax season we've been growing customers by >30% month-over-month. We've completely automated over 25% of the return process so far and developed a proprietary vision model that beats incumbent scanning technology by almost 2x on accuracy - jumping from 50% field-level accuracy to 89%, approaching the quality of their expensive human-verified service at 92%.

The opportunity is massive - there are 80M US personal tax returns filed via professionals annually, in a $2B outsourcing market where individual CPA firms currently pay $100k-$1M per year for inferior services. We're positioned to capture significant market share by offering better accuracy & document coverage, instant processing, and superior user experience.

We've built this kind of software before, we've worked together for years (and even lived together), we've built products to $10M ARR before, and we have the grit to outwork anyone in this space.
one_liner: AI Tax Preparer for CPA firms

name: Modelence
long_description:
You built the demo in a weekend. Now you need auth, a prod-grade database, real-time events, AI observability, cron jobs, email, monitoring… and you needed them yesterday.

We spent a decade at our previous startup, building a platform while scaling to millions of users and customers like Meta & Netflix. Now we put that into an open-source framework, so others wouldn’t have to do the same from scratch.

Modelence is a batteries-included framework that abstracts away boilerplate so you can just focus on building your product logic and nothing else - it’s like Next.js + Vercel + Supabase on a single platform, built for full-stack TypeScript.

Shipping production apps is much harder than building a prototype that runs locally and 95% of all production apps share the same building blocks. We did a massive amount of work on our previous platforms that was not specific to our product, and we’ve created Modelence to abstract that away:
- Authentication
- Database setup
- Hosting / CDN
- AI integration (LLM observability, prompts)
- Real-time events
- Cron jobs
- Email service
- Monitoring
- Analytics
- Admin dashboards

Andrej Karpathy recently posted about this same exact problem:
https://x.com/karpathy/status/1905051558783418370

and explained it further in his YC AI Startup School talk:
https://youtu.be/LCEmiRjPEtQ?feature=shared&t=1940
one_liner: All-in-one TypeScript cloud for production AI apps

name: Perspectives Health
long_description:
America is facing an addiction and mental health crisis. We're building a suite of AI agents to automate away the tasks that occupy half of the time and resources of behavioral health clinics—documentation, compliance, audits, and more.

We save time, money, and mental bandwidth so that clinicians can stop chasing insurance reimbursements and go back to saving lives.
one_liner: Automating away admin for behavioral health clinics

name: Duranium
long_description:
China and Russia control the world’s critical minerals. We can produce Titanium, Magnesium, Aluminum, Zirconium & Hafnium in the U.S. more profitably than any existing process, and carbon neutrally via co-production.

Carbochlorination is the primary process for producing critical metals like titanium, hafnium, and zirconium, and was once the standard for magnesium. The problem: conventional carbochlorination relies on purchasing carbon feedstocks, wastes valuable byproducts, and is highly CO₂-intensive.

Duranium changes this with a novel reactor that recycles CO₂ emissions back into feedstock (CO) while generating a valuable co-product (bleaching agents). This closed loop slashes emissions and delivers Chinese-level metal pricing without subsidies — unlocking the full potential of carbochlorination for U.S. critical mineral production.
one_liner: Reshoring critical metal production

name: TectoAI
long_description: We help your company identify roles that can be filled by agentic AI tools, onboard them quickly, monitor their performance and behavior post deployment, ensure they remain compliant, and aligned with regulations. Tecto is building the governance platform for managing the AI stack!
one_liner: A Platform for AI Governance

name: RowFlow
long_description:
RowFlow replaces clunky web forms with natural conversations that run over text, slack, or wherever your users are. Our platform increases your form’s response rates while cutting your internal overhead in half. 

With RowFlow, you can take any existing form and instantly convert it into an AI-powered conversation. New flows launch in minutes and reach respondents over your preferred channel or embedded chat. We guide the exchange, follow up automatically, and return clean structured data without extra work from your team.

Forms power billions of business interactions yearly. Whether it’s forms for client intake, registrations, compliance, feedback, or surveys, they all follow the same painful pattern: low conversion, messy data, and frustrated users. Teams have long tolerated forms only because there's been no scalable alternative for collecting structured information from people - until now. Our goal is for RowFlow to become the new default way for how organizations collect user data in an AI-first world.
one_liner: Replacing forms with AI conversations

name: Munify
long_description: Munify is the cross-border Neobank for the Middle East and its diaspora. Instantly open a USD account, get a virtual card, and send money home at the best rates, all from one app.
one_liner: The Cross-Border Neobank for the Middle East

name: Interfere
one_liner: Build software that never breaks

name: Spotlight Realty
long_description: We are a full-service sell-side residential brokerage that lists and markets your properties. We also screen and schedule tenants showings with our AI agent for a third of the normal commission.
one_liner: AI powered brokerage reducing residential rental commissions in NYC…

name: Vulcan Technologies
long_description:
Vulcan uses AI to map every law, regulation, and court case in America, allowing government agencies and businesses to replace massive consulting projects with instant automated analyses. We call this "intelligent legal cartography."

In 3 months, we went from zero customers to Virginia's Executive Order 51, requiring all state agencies to use Vulcan. We are now live with the U.S. Department of Education, a regulatory reform PAC in South Carolina, and have a pipeline of several additional state and federal agencies and major enterprises.

Our initial agency partners use legal cartography to draft lawful regulations, respond to public comments on regulations, and instantly generate mandatory cost-benefit analyses.

We have both public and private sector visions. In the public sector: we endeavor to automate the entire regulatory process end-to-end; replacing the consulting industrial complex with software. In the private sector: we plan to automate regulatory compliance, tackling the $4 trillion regulatory cost on the U.S. economy.
one_liner: AI regulatory drafting and compliance

name: NOSO LABS
long_description: In the home services industry, field technicians are expected to handle three key tasks: diagnosing issues, making sales, and completing paperwork. It's rare to find individuals who excel at all three. We build AI agents to support technicians by improving diagnostic accuracy and helping them capture sales opportunities.
one_liner: Build AI agents for field technicians to diagnose and sell 10x better

name: Outrove
long_description: Outrove is the world’s most realistic AI recruiter, with a human-appearing interview agent that has both video and audio and can join Google Meet calls.
one_liner: Ultra-realistic AI Recruiter

name: Veritus
long_description:
Veritus is a omni-channel platform for deploying AI agents for loan servicing and collections, including inbound and outbound voice agents. Our agents negotiate repayment plans, follow up across channels, and drive recoveries with zero human involvement.

By combining cutting edge voice AI with deep regulatory compliance and vertical specialization we're able to drastically reduce the cost-to-collect while increasing recovery rates.
one_liner: AI agents for the consumer lending industry

name: Ruvo
long_description:
Ruvo is a global account for receiving, holding, and moving money between USD and BRL.

We connect Pix, crypto, and Visa so you can receive USD from abroad, convert between USD and BRL in minutes, send money to the U.S., spend worldwide, and save in digital dollars with yield — all in one place.

Ruvo supports both personal (CPF) and business (CNPJ) accounts, with low fees, strong security, and direct Pix settlement.

Formerly known as Cacao.
one_liner: The Global Dollar App for Brazil

name: Avent
long_description:
Avent helps manufacturers and industrial distributors run quoting and order entry on autopilot. 

Our AI agents manage sales inboxes, build quotes from past pricing and tribal knowledge, and keep records up to date in existing ERPs.
one_liner: AI agents for industrial commerce

name: burnt
long_description:
Food Supply Chain companies have been using legacy ERPs for decades. Everyone knows these are necessary evils that essentially run the business but take up a lot of operational capacity. They are not about to just rip and replace their existing system that runs their whole business with a system that takes years to implement. Imagine if they could implement AI that runs the ERP for them, in weeks?

Burnt’s building an agentic OS for the Food Supply Chain with AI Agents for each department. 

Our AI Agent, Ozai, has started by replacing the whole order management job function at food distribution companies, so that sales and customer service teams can focus on what matters - the customer. Ozai monitors all incoming messages (emails, phone calls, voicemails, whatsapp, fax etc.), figures out if it's an order, learns each customer's habits, shorthand, and favorite products, picks up on any prep notes, and enters it straight into the existing ERP. It'll even go back to the customers on your behalf when it's not sure about something, clarify things and carry on working. 

The more it sees, the smarter it gets.
one_liner: Agentic Operating System for Food Supply Chain

name: Freya
one_liner: Voice AI for Enterprises

name: Luminal
long_description:
Luminal builds an ML framework and compiler that generates GPU code.
Our stack 10x's model speed while simplifying deployment and cutting idle GPU costs

Github: https://github.com/luminal-ai/luminal
Discord: https://discord.gg/APjuwHAbGy
one_liner: Making AI run fast on any hardware.

name: RealRoots
long_description: This is where real friendships begin. Women use our mobile app to talk to Lisa, our AI matchmaker, and get set up for fun social experiences with compatible new friends, all planned and coordinated by AI.
one_liner: AI social app for women

name: Uplift AI
long_description:
We build Voice Models for regional languages (like Urdu, Bengali, Greek etc) and make them available through simple APIs and SDKs. 
Developers use us to create Voice-first digital experiences (eg. Voice eCommerce, Voice Banking, Voice AI Tutors etc).

We gather our own data, develop our own labelling tools, train our own models, and design our own voice infra. This fully integrated approach enables us to offer the best models and the best developer experience for regional languages.

---

People who would previously never use certain digital services (like online ordering), actually use the service when they are given an intuitive Voice based interface.
We believe that Voice Interfaces will onboard 100s of millions of new users onto digital services; and double the addressable market for technology companies. 
Uplift AI will provide the best models to create these Voice Interfaces for 60% of the world's population that only speaks their regional language and represents 42 trillion dollars in GDP.
one_liner: Foundational Voice Models for regional languages

name: Paloma
long_description: We unify your contracts, service consumption, and customer relationship context so that your revenue, success and sales teams can operate from the same ground truth. With everything centralized, you can proactively react to customer signals for upsell and churn while billing is seamlessly handled in the background.
one_liner: AI-native CRM for putting post-sales operations on autopilot

name: Blue
long_description:
Blue is the first voice assistant on iOS and Android that can control every app on your phone, so you can get work done hands-free.

It reads and replies to messages and email across apps, attaches photos and files, books and pays, manages calendar items, and more.

Unlike assistants that stop at answers or timers, Blue taps, types, and swipes inside your existing apps with no app-specific integrations. On iPhone, a tiny USB-C plug-in (“Bud”) provides precise input control so Blue can act on your behalf. (Android support is in testing.)

Blue is already in real-world use: people are clearing inboxes, paying bills from email, sharing files, and moving through routine flows while their hands are busy.

The team brings complementary experience at scale: Omar Abdelaziz led Google Assistant’s transition to LLMs and holds one of earliest patents in LLM-based computer control; Peter Krogh spent decades designing voice-first dialog systems and was most recently a design lead at Google DeepMind building actions for Gemini Live; Muhammad Farhan Hossain helped ship Apple Vision Pro, is named on dozens of hardware/systems patents, and has led products from prototype to mass production.

We’ve built systems used by billions. Now we’re on to defining the next era of computing.
one_liner: The first voice assistant that can control every app on your iPhone

name: Nox Metals
long_description: Nox Metals is building the fastest metals processing factories in North America. Our software runs quoting, scheduling, and operations to streamline production and reduce cost. We supply America's industrial base with custom-cut material at unmatched speed and efficiency.
one_liner: The modern factory for fast, low-cost metals.

name: F2
long_description:
F2 is the AI platform for private markets investors. Purpose-built for private credit, private equity, and commercial banking, F2 accelerates diligence, underwriting, and portfolio monitoring, helping teams evaluate deals over 60% faster. 

F2 turns unstructured deal data into investment-grade analysis and polished memos in minutes. Unlike general-purpose AI, F2 is built with the domain expertise and depth to handle the most complex financial analysis. Already trusted across thousands of deals, F2 makes collaboration easy and retains historical context, so past work compounds into future wins. 

Headquartered in New York City, F2 is backed by leading investors including NFX, Left Lane Capital, and Y Combinator.
one_liner: The AI platform for private markets investors
